args: We've come for your food, maggots—\nand you better have it waiting!
It's all loaded up on the cart\nand ready to go, handsome.
Well, if it ain't Malora. Ya always make\nthings simple for us, darlin'—and it helps\nthat yer easy on the eyes! Bwa ha ha!

Ya know, I'm gonna be a pretty big cheese
once King Galkin's back in charge, and I'd 
be happy to shower ya with all the riches
what we squeeze outta these low-lifes.
Ooo, that sounds wonderful!\n(...In your dreams, creep-o.)

Oh, and ya better get all yer friends to start
butterin' us up, or else they might wind up
stretchin' on the end of a rope like all the
other traitors! Bwaaaa ha ha ha!
We could hear them from inside the cart.\nThese people are truly abhorrent.
I am loath to even name them soldiers.
We cannot allow such tyranny to go\nunchecked. We must take action and...\nShhh! The cart is moving.
That does it for everyone in this area.
He defeated all of those enemies in no\ntime at all...
Good thing he's on our side.
We'll split up and overpower the enemy.\nCrush any foe who crosses your path!
We must not permit Galkin to escape,\nso keep a close eye out for him.\nAnd lastly...
R-run, General Valyx... You need not\nmeet your end this day...
Lastly, I would see you all come through\nthis alive. Now move out and stay alert.
Didn't expect that from a dude who used\nto be a general in the imperial army...

(I still don't understand him. Was
preventing the country from being
further divided really Valyx's only
reason for staying in the Empire?)
(According to Malora's sketch, they're\nusing this area as a command center.)

Your appearance matches the information
we received from Malora. You're a high-
ranking official who worked closely with
the former king.
Speak, and do it quickly. Where is Galkin?
I have no idea where His Majesty is!\nI don't know anything, I swear!
And yet you can't seem to help yourself\nfrom staring at that bookshelf.
As I suspected, the shelf hides a secret\npassage. This isn't on the sketch, so...
(Jewels? Art? Gold? This is clearly a\nvault for the former king's fortune.)
I never thought any would dare step foot\ninside my sacred domain.
Indeed I am! And you must be the fourth\nscion of Alberia, General Valyx.

I do. In truth, I was planning to invade
Alberia before my little...incident, so I
sent a spy to learn all they could about
your delightful country.

I'm so envious of you Alberian royalty.
Fertile lands, boundless resources,
AND powerful dragonblood in your veins?
Why, you're blessed beyond measure!
Just the thought of having such things\nunder my control makes me giddy as a\nschoolboy.
Which is why you have been waging war\non surrounding nations for all this time.\nYour greed truly knows no bounds.
You would turn against all a ruler stands\nfor despite knowing full well how it will\nbring suffering to your people!
My country is my possession, and my\npeople mere tools to be used as I see fit.\nThey all exist to satisfy me—their king!
From my perspective, YOU are the strange\none. Royalty serving as a general in order\nto shield some peasants? What madness!
A country is a home to its people,\nand it is the duty of those who rule\nover it to safeguard those lives.
Enough. It is clear you and I will never\nsee eye to eye on this or any other issue.
Ah, but I did not come to understand you.\nI came to stop you.

Well, I can't have you doing that, now can
I? Thankfully, I brought a little bargaining
chip to ensure I can reclaim my power and
reap all the rewards of royal life.
*cough* *cough* M-my body is...heavy...\nWhat have you done?!
Why, I've deployed a magical implement\ncalled a Brume! It's a lovely little device\nthat emits a colorless, odorless mist.

Seeing as I've already taken the antitoxin,
I will be fine. But alas, I fear the mana in
your own body is starting to break down,
which will lead to your inevitable demise.

Oh, please! Don't try to stand! It's just
embarrassing for both of us. However,
if you're willing to make an arrangement,
I might be able to help you.
After I've regained my throne, I plan to\ntake Alberia and claim the power of the\ndragonblood for my own.
If you swear fealty to me now and agree\nto assist in the invasion, I will gladly give\nyou the antitoxin.
You abandoned that country once before,\nyes? It shouldn't be that difficult for you to\ndo so again.
Do not mistake me for a coward who might\nbetray his country to save his own neck!
You can still move? Oh, how delightful!\nThe dragonblood DOES run strong in you!
Ah, but what of your underlings?
Huh, what's this room?\nIt's not on the map... *cough* *hack*
M-my body's so heavy...and I feel like my\nchest is on fire!
No! You should not have come here!
(...Damnation! Galkin escaped while I was\nfocused on the soldiers!)
(He must have taken a secondary route\nout of the vault. I'm sure we could find it\nif we looked, but...)
...This place is full of magic mist.\nGetting fresh air has to be our priority.
I know you are in pain, but stay strong\nand fight until we reach the exit.
I...I can't go on... Just leave me here...
I do not give you permission to die,\nsoldier! Now move!
Th-the mine is starting to collapse!
(Galkin must have devised a way\nto destroy his own base...)
(We'll never make it back to the exit\nat the pace we're going now.)
All of you, stay close! I will shapeshift\nand serve as your shield!
